values.value: Human leukocyte antigen (HLA) is a protein that is found on the surface of white blood cells and some other cells. White blood cells are part of the immune system (your body’s natural defense system). These proteins help the white blood cells to identify the body’s own cells from invaders. There are different types of HLAs and every person has a unique combination (a profile). This test will identify your HLA profile. It is thought that certain cancer treatments (such as immunotherapy) may work well for people with certain HLA profiles. This test may help doctors predict which cancer treatments may work for you.
